creator: jonathan.woods@scintillance.com
text:
I'm running Tomcat 5.5.15 on Linux (kernel 2.6.9).  If I drop a .war file into
catalina.base and it is auto-deployed, then directories created under the
webapp's tree are world-readable, whereas in fact they (and the files within
them) should be readable only by the user/group running Tomcat.

I'm sorry; I mis-identified Tomcat version.  Now corrected as nearly as
possible, 5.5.15 not being in the drop-down.
creator: jonathan.woods@scintillance.com

text:
Updated version.

Not that Tomcat and (Java in general, being OS-agnostic) don't have a mechanism
to  distinguish user- from group- and world-level permissions, unless I'm
greatly mistaken.  Instead, the permissions for these files are determined by
the umask (google or man the term if unfamiliar) of the server user: that's what
you need adjust.

Accordingly, this is not a Tomcat issue.
creator: yoavs@computer.org

text:
Thanks for the explanation - I see what you mean.  I imagine the permissions
also depend on the ownership of the initial .war file too, so perhaps the
documentation ought to mention that.
